content: Is there an easy way to see what assembly the compiler generates for a function in the standard library?
rust.godbolt.org, write a function that wraps the one you're interested in, just passing args and return value untouched
Assuming it's public, that is. If not, maybe you can copy the code wholesale.
The playground can show asm too, using the menu next to "run", but godbolt is nicer for this.

A quick example: https://rust.godbolt.org/z/4fjTMz
(Since I had it available from a recent PR. Definitely harder if it's something that's non-inline and non-generic, though.)
